org.openglove.api.java

Class OpenGlove

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openglove.api.java.OpenGlove

  • public class OpenGlove
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an OpenGlove device instance. Provide methods for communicatiopn with the device, initialize and activate vibration motors, besides others actuators and sensors

    • Method Detail

      • openPort

        public boolean openPort(java.lang.String portName,
                        int baudRate)
        Open the communication with the port and baudrate specified
        Parameters:
        portName - Name of the serial port to open a communication
        baudRate - Data rate in bits per second. Use one of these values: 300, 600, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 14400, 19200, 28800, 38400, 57600, or 115200
        Returns:
        Return True if the port was opened sucesfully

      • closePort

        public void closePort()
        Close the current active serial communication

      • getPortNames

        public java.lang.String[] getPortNames()
        List all active serial ports names
        Returns:
        An array with the names of all active serial ports

      • initializeMotor

        public void initializeMotor(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pins)
        Initialize pins like motors in the control software
        Parameters:
        pins - List of pins that are initialized

      • activateMotor

        public void activateMotor(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pins,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Activate motors with analog or digital values. Each motor is activated with the value with the same index
        Parameters:
        pins - List of pins where are connected the motors
        values - List with the intensities to activate the motors. It can be "HIGH" or "LOW" in digital mode or a number bewteen 0 and 255 in analog mode

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
        Read the input buffet until a next line character
        Returns:
        A string without the next line character

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        message -

      • analogRead

        public java.lang.String analogRead(int pin)
        Returns the input voltage from a analog pin
        Parameters:
        pin - Number of the analog pin to be readed
        Returns:
        The input voltage readed form the analog pin, between 0 and 1023. This value must be converted to be used like temperature, etc.

      • digitalRead

        public java.lang.String digitalRead(int pin)
        Returns the value from a digital pin
        Parameters:
        pin - Number of the digital pin to be readed
        Returns:
        1 for "HIGH" or 0 for "LOW"

      • pinMode

        public void pinMode(int pin,
                    java.lang.String mode)
        Initialize a pin in input or output mode
        Parameters:
        pin - Number of the pin to be initialized
        mode - Mode to initialize the pin, it can be "INPUT" or "OUTPUT"

      • pinMode

        public void pinMode(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pins,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> modes)
        Initialize multiples pins in input or output mode. Each pin is initialized with the mode in the same index
        Parameters:
        pins - List with the numbers of the pins to be initialized
        modes - List with the modes to initialize the pins, it can be "INPUT" or "OUTPUT"

      • digitalWrite

        public void digitalWrite(int pin,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Write a value to a digital pin
        Parameters:
        pin - Number of the pin to be writed
        value - Value to be write in the pin, it can be "HIGH" or "LOW"

      • digitalWrite

        public void digitalWrite(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pins,
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Write values on digital pins. Each motor is activated with the value with the same index
        Parameters:
        pins - List with the numbers of the pins to be initialized
        values - List with the values to write on the pins, it can be "HIGH" or "LOW"

      • analogWrite

        public void analogWrite(int pin,
                        int value)
        Write an analog value to a pin
        Parameters:
        pin - Number of the pin to be writed
        value - Value to be write in the pin, it can be between 0 (always off) and 255 (always on)

      • analogWrite

        public void analogWrite(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pins,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> values)
        Write analog values to pins. Each motor is activated with the value with the same index
        Parameters:
        pins - List with the numbers of the pins to be writed
        values - List with the values to write on the pins, it can be between 0 (always off) and 255 (always on)
